name: NPR
text: Macron urged Lebanon's leaders to act in the best interest of the country, making apparent allusion to outrage at the country's ruling class following the blast. https://t.co/OMisbrpne4

name: NPR
text:
Think of a famous living person in the entertainment field whose first name is a bird. The person's last name is a quality of this bird — something its feathers have. Who's the famous person, and what's the bird?

Submit your answer using the link below.
https://t.co/1UUy2ReW4l

name: NPR
text:
"You aren't going to have the year you thought you'd have."

That's what a nurse told Marc Silver and his wife after she was diagnosed with cancer. He reflects on how that journey prepared them both to adapt during this unpredictable and chaotic time.
https://t.co/Wjb1DfOVZc

name: NPR
text: Telemundo commentator Andrés Cantor is best known for his legendary goal calls. But there's much more to his life and career. @OnlyAGameNPR https://t.co/PXmsDZJXy3

name: NPR
text:
Are you interested in political maneuverings and space economics, fantastically rich worldbuilding and sneaky spy stories? 

Our reviewer says "First Sister" might be just the book you've been waiting for.
https://t.co/I0oaHJa8Y4

name: NPR
text:
The National Virtual Medical Orchestra brings together classical musicians in the medical field, giving them a chance to perform and connect.

"We try to play all the notes, but if we hit the wrong one, it's not life or death," one doctor says.
https://t.co/LNd9q8e7Au

name: NPR
text:
It's back to school season, but that looks different all across the U.S. With so many plans for reopening schools, we want to hear what plans have been proposed where you live and how they're affecting your daily life.
https://t.co/WcmxcKV1Zd

name: NPR
text: Months after George Floyd was killed by police, activists say there's still work to do. At such a painful moment in U.S. history, in the middle of a global pandemic and movement for racial justice, how do activists continue to fight without burning out? https://t.co/Mk9szZf94z

name: NPR
text: Jimmy Lai is chairman and majority owner of the pro-democratic newspaper "Apple Daily" and its publishing company. Share prices for Next Media surged 300% within hours of his arrest, as democracy supporters urged each other online to support the company. https://t.co/uhBSSS8wHZ

name: NPR
text: Trump’s crime attacks on Biden are seen as “far from reality” by a politically diverse NPR/Marist focus group of Phoenix-area voters. They also were unimpressed with the president's performance on the pandemic and race relations. https://t.co/44vpMUhsvc
